member.name: ITfUIElementSink.BeginUIElement
member.summary: The ITfUIElementSink.BeginUIElement method is called when the UIElement started. This sink can let the textservice to draw or not to draw the UI element.
member.param: [in] Id of the UIElement that was started.

[in, out] Return true if the application does not draw the UIElement content and the text service draws its original UI content. Return false if the application draws the UIElement's content and stops the text service from drawing it. The application can get the interface by using and it can evaluate if it can handle the UIElement by QI with IID_ITfCandidateListUIElement or with other UIElement interfaces. The application can always return FALSE if it is unknown or it cannot be handled. In this case, the text service will not show any extra UI on the screen. This is a good way for some full screen applications. Alternatively, the application can return TRUE to use TextService's UI on some particular or unknown UIs.

returns.para: The TSF manager ignores the return value of this method.

member.name: ITfUIElementSink.EndUIElement
member.summary: The ITfUIElementSink.EndUIElement method is called when the UIElement is finished.
member.param: [in] Id of the UIElement that is finished.
member.returns: The TSF manager ignores the return value of this method.

member.name: ITfUIElementSink.UpdateUIElement
member.summary: The ITfUIElementSink.UpdateUIElement method is called when the contents of the UIElement is updated.
member.param: [in] Id of the UIElement that has had its content updated.
member.returns: The TSF manager ignores the return value of this method.

member.name: ITfUIElementSink
member.summary: The ITfUIElementSink interface is implemented by an application to receive notifications when the UI element is changed.
